I guess I deserve that

I guess I deserve that for not looking over my slides before the talk. One slide was misplaced.

I was trying to distinguish between the superficial simplicity advocated throughout the book which I called "simplistic" and is usually created by complicated frameworks like Rails and inherent simplicity which is followed by Einsteins maxim: "Make things as simple as possible, but not simpler." and exhibits complex behavior because they are a bunch of highly cohesive, loosely coupled systems. The analogy I used was bird migration, but I could have just as easily pointed to how the unix toolchain works.

But the general complexified ;-) gist of my talk is this: Internet Architecture is ugly like an Ogre, until you realize there is a art in that ugliness. I try to find the ugly parts, layer by layer, and show you why I think it's an art. :-D
